comment: I much appreciate you telling us about the charities you have supported especially when Alfie spoke about the young man’s birthday party and the eye gaze computer! Here in Switzerland, on Christmas Eve it is not Santa but the Christchindli (basically Baby Jesus, even for me as a not religious person) that brings presents.  On Dec 6th, we have Saint Nikolas (Samichlaus here) bringing the kids a bag full of peanuts, mandarines ans chocolates. He will talk to each kid and tell them, what they did really good and what they can improve in. When my dad was a kid, the Samichlaus would put naughty kids in his bag 😳

i already commented this on that video where it was addressed, but i like the wrapping! if you want, you could add black bells or pinecones or sprigs to the presents to make them more festive if you are still unsure!

Forgive the ramble, but in regards to the conversation about charity, I think it's a great topic for everyone to talk about more often. By opening up more platforms for discussion and awareness, you wouldn't only be helping the charities, but viewers who need certain kinds of aid that weren't aware it was even on offer. I think by talking about it you would really help people start thinking outside of the box when it comes to helping others as well.
I completely understand why you would have been hesitant though-for people in your positions where you have the ability to provide such financial and resourceful help to others, it's one of those situations where you're damned if you do talk about it and damned if you don't. But similar to what Alfie said: people who misinterpret your intention, misinterpret your intention. As long as you know you're doing it for the right reasons and it's actually helping people, I think that's all that matters.
You are absolutely allowed to talk about the good things you do ! The world needs more positive news 💛💛💛

Ahh I loved the stories about charities!! Funding certain things are difficult, a few years my mother and a few other mums of special needs kids have started a foundation that is called “stichting puzzelstuk” translated (from Dutch) in foundation puzzle piece! It is a foundation in which we are going to built a home for 12 kids with for example autism to have a forever home, a safe and good place with professional care so they are happy because eventually the parents can’t provide the care that is needed anymore! Very painful reality. So my brother is going to live there, he has down syndrome and he loves it at our home at the moment just with my parents and my little brother, he is so easy going. Loves his life. But the worst thought for me is, what if he isn’t happy somewhere he has to live eventually... this foundation has given me and my parents the chance to be much more involved in his forever home and we love it 💕🏠
The house will be built in 2023, so not there yet haha. But the funding of it is a whole other thing... think about bathrooms and furniture of the mean areas all special arrangements in the kitchen and stuff 😅 so I really loved to see you guys are involved in so many projects to help people in need, because you don’t know what impact it has on the people in need💕 thank you!

Santa Claus, which is shortened to Santa, or Sinter Klaas if you're Dutch, was originally St. Nicholas, the patron saint of children. Father Christmas, or Pere Noel if you're French, is a legendary figure of pre-medieval England. The French took him as Pere Noel after one of their defeats during many wars with the English. Both were known as gift-givers. You are welcome.
